title.justification: The title 'Parametric Scattering Networks' is clearly indicated multiple times in the document, including in the introduction and abstract.
title.quote:
Ce mémoire intitulé

Parametric Scattering Networks

extractions.description: This research focuses on adapting wavelet filters used in scattering networks by learning their parameters to produce task-specific parameterizations. The approach is named Parametric Scattering Networks and is particularly beneficial for tasks with limited labeled data.

type.justification: The paper describes empirical studies, such as the application and testing of the parametric scattering networks on datasets like CIFAR-10, COVIDx CRX-2, and KTH-TIPS2, indicating it is empirical research.
type.quote: We empirically demonstrate that our parametric scattering network shares similar stability to deformations as the traditional scattering transform.

name.justification: The paper discusses methods related to deep learning, including learning parameters of wavelet networks and using CNN architectures.
name.quote:
Most breakthroughs in deep learning have required considerable effort to collect massive
amounts of well-annotated data.

name.justification: Convolutional Neural Networks are mentioned as related to the scattering networks used in this study.
name.quote:
The scattering transform, proposed in [93], is a cascade of wavelets and complex mo-
dulus nonlinearities, which can be thought as a convolutional neural network (CNN) with
predetermined filters.

name.justification: The paper addresses learning with limited labeled data, which is a key aspect of few-shot learning.
name.quote:
there are many applications where annotating more than a small number of samples is impractical, leading
to growing interest in small sample learning tasks

name.justification: The main focus of the paper is on adapting the scattering transform using learned parameters.
name.quote:
We propose to learn the scales, orientations, and aspect ratios of the fil-
ters to produce problem-specific parameterizations of the scattering transform.

name.justification: The model introduced and developed in the paper is the Parametric Scattering Network, which learns the parameters of scattering transforms.
name.quote: We call our approach the Parametric Scattering Network.

is_contributed.justification: The paper introduces the Parametric Scattering Network as its primary novel contribution.
is_contributed.quote:
In the thesis, we propose to learn the scales, orientations, and aspect ratios of the fil-
ters to produce problem-specific parameterizations of the scattering transform. We call our
approach the Parametric Scattering Network.

is_executed.justification: The Parametric Scattering Network was executed and tested on various datasets such as CIFAR-10 and COVIDx CRX-2.
is_executed.quote:
We first compare dataset-specific Morlet wavelet parameterizations and evaluate their
similarities to a tight frame.

is_compared.justification: The Model is compared against existing non-parametric scattering networks and other models like WRN and ResNet.
is_compared.quote:
We also empirically demonstrate that the parametric scattering network trained in a
supervised and unsupervised manner yields significant performance gains in small-sample classification settings over the standard scattering network.
